title: Bihar Congress suspends party’s Buxar district president for poor turnout at Kharge’s rally
content: About 10,000 chairs had been arranged for the ‘Jai Bapu, Jai Bhim, Jai Samvidhan’ rally; a video of thousands of empty chairs went viral on social media; the Bihar Assembly election is due to be held later this year

title: Water samples test negative for contamination, situation monitored in Woraiyur, says Tiruchi Corporation
content: A total of 40 special health teams have been deployed in the affected areas to check and monitor the condition of the residents and 15 medical teams have set up camps in the area

title: Should KCR be remembered for pushing Telangana into ₹8 lakh crore debt, Congress asks KTR
content: People have rejected the BRS twice as people realised their misgovernance, only KCR’s family members were happy with the BRS rule, the Congress MP said

title: Farmers’ body opposes transfer of Kovur Sugar factory’s 124-acre land to APIIC
content: Leaders of Sugarcane Farmers’ Association urge all the shareholders, farmers and others to attend a conference to be held at the sugar factory premises on April 24 to discuss an action plan

title: Work on first automatic signalling in Kerala gains pace
content: Approval given for physical works on the Ernakulam-Shoranur stretch. The ₹156.47-crore work is expected to be completed in one-and-a-half years

title: Steps underway to ease Vizianagaram’s water supply shortfall
content: Vizianagaram civic body plans to draw water from Andra reservoir amid supply deficit and rising summer demand

title: ‘Pope consistently championed dialogue and interfaith respect’
content: Pope Francis chose to directly engage with Islamic leaders, undertaking historic papal visits across the Muslim world, and striving to build bridges of peace and understanding

title: Small arms factory set up by UAE’s Caracal with Megha Group firm ICOMM opened
content: Comprehensive portfolio of advanced weapons under a tech transfer agreement with Caracal to be manufactured at the facility in Hyderabad

title: Farmers seek relief from ‘false cases’ in leopard’s death near Madanapalle
content: Forest officials resorted to arresting their family members without any notice or inquiry, allege farmers

title: Construction of Polavaram project’s ECRF dam commenced parallel to new diaphram wall works, says Water Resource Minister Nimmala Rama Naidu
content: ‘The diaphragm wall works worth ₹990 crore are in full swing while ₹1,200 crore has been allocated to complete the Left Main Canal of the project to provide irrigation and drinking water for the North Andhra region, including Visakhapatnam city, for industrial needs’

title: It is not right to blame State govt. for the Janivara incident, says Minister
content: The State govt. has initiated disciplinary action against officials involved, according to Satish Jarkiholi

title: No Syro-Malabar representation in upcoming papal election as Cardinal Alencherry turns 80
content: According to Church protocol, only cardinals under the age of 80 are permitted to vote in the papal conclave, which decides the next pope

title: CMO closely monitoring PGRS, Annamayya Collector tells officials
content: He instructs the officials to initiate prompt action on all pending requests from the public, particularly those beyond the Service Level Agreement timelines

title: Six arrested on murder charge in Kalaburagi
content: Police made the arrest in connection with the murder of a 28-year-old man from Zhalki (K) village in Aland taluk

title: Pope Francis was an apostle of peace and harmony, says Archbishop Joseph Pamplany
content: Pope Francis was an apostle of peace who responded not with force, but with compassion, when imperial powers like Israel, America, or Russia chose the path of violence, says the Archbishop

title: Farmers, traders warned against use of calcium carbide for artificial ripening of mangoes
content: Sale, transportation and storage of calcium carbide is prohibited, and the violations will be dealt with under Section 44(A), which attracts three years of imprisonment and a fine of ₹1,000, says Chittoor Joint Collector

title: Swiss team coming soon for preparing DPR on e-RT service between Hubballi and Dharwad
content: Labour Minister says this follows the Memorandum of Understanding signed between the State government and the Swiss company

title: FIR to be filed against those who removed sacred thread of students
content: Labour Minister says the government has taken the issue seriously and wants a detailed probe to be conducted

title: Members of various Brahmin associations stage protest against Janivara incidents
content: BJP MLA Abhay Patil joins protest, says an insult to Brahmins is an insult to the larger Hindu society

title: Tahawwur Rana wants to talk to family, moves court
content: Tahawwur Rana moved a plea through his counsel on April 19 before special judge Hardeep Kaur, who on April 21 directed the NIA to file a reply by April 23

title: Drone technology has reduced farmers’ hardships, says A.P. R&B Minister
content: Janardhan Reddy interacts with the farmers after distributing farm equipment to the beneficiaries at Kovelakuntla in Nandyal district

title: State government to go ahead with Global City project, says P. Rajeeve
content: Kerala government will have to bear an additional burden with the Union government withdrawing from the project, says State Industries Minister

title: Mango season begins in Yadgir as the king of fruits arrives in varieties
content: Arrivals include those grown by local farmers and from Kalaburagi, Raichur, Tandur (Telangana), Ratnagiri (Maharashtra) and Andhra Pradesh

title: Pope’s passing a huge loss for humanity, says Kunhalikutty
content: Mr. Kunhalikutty said Pope Francis had shown an unwavering commitment to the marginalised and the downtrodden

title: Sri Ram Sene stages protest in Dharwad over Janivara issue
content: Some people from the Brahmin community are preparing to approach the High Court, says Pramod Mutalik

title: Farmers call for early steps to renovate apron drownstream Cauvery barrage at Mukkombu
content: WRD sources say a proposal for repairing the apron at a cost of about ₹150 crore has been forwarded to the government for approval; farmers disappointed that funds were not allocated in State Budget

title: SPMVV receives ISO certification
content: The certificates include ISO 21001:2018 (Educational organisation management system), ISO 50001:2018 (Energy management system) and ISO 14001:2015 (Environmental management system)

title: Demonstration staged against Waqf Amendment Act in Tirupati
content: Secular Constitution Protection Forum, a newly-formed body predominantly comprising of Left parties, Muslim organisations and Dalit outfits, calls the amendment a blatant violation of the constitutional protection to the minorities

title: Catholicos describes Pope Francis as one of the most radiant voices in Christian leadership
content: Catholicos of the Jacobite Church Baselios Joseph calls him the voice of the suppressed and the voiceless

title: 2024 protest case: Delhi court summons Trinamool leaders Derek O’Brien, Sagarika Ghose, Saket Gokhale, others
content: Additional chief judicial magistrate Neha Mittal also summoned TMC leaders Santanu Sen, Dola Sen, Nadimul Haque, Vivek Gupta, Arpita Ghosh, Abir Ranjan Bishwas and Sudip Raha to appear on April 30

title: PM Modi to flag off first 16-coach Namo Bharat train between Jayanagar-Patna on April 24
content: Officials said that the train can accommodate 1000 more passengers who can stand using handrails, straps, or poles to maintain balance during the train's movement

title: Social boycott of Dalits by Kapu community at Mallam village in Kakinada district withdrawn after peace committee’s intervention
content: Both the groups signed a pact under the aegis of the peace committee and agreed to live in harmony, says the District Collector

title: Processing centre for small onions in Uppiliyapuram inactive for five years
content: Officials the location of the facility in a remote place and the prospect of cost escalation have been major deterrents for farmers of small onions in using the facility

title: Andhra Pradesh plans to build a world-class international cricket stadium in Amaravati’s Sports City
content: Municipal Administration and Urban Development Minister P. Narayana, along with officials, visits Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad and interacts with Gujarat sports authorities

title: Government committed to well-being of children with special needs: Tirupati MLA
content: We have 34 ‘Bhavitha’ schools in the district, with one in each mandal, where the children will be specially trained and provided education, says Arani Srinivasulu

title: Sustainable farming: Pests drop to zero in chilli, tomato crops after adoption of biocontrol agents
content: Emphasising that not all pest problems require chemical solutions, the AEO explained that overuse of pesticides has not only reduced biodiversity but also led to frequent pest outbreaks due to monoculture practices

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Bengal Governor Bose hospitalised with chest congestion; condition stable: Official
content: Medical examinations were conducted upon his arrival and following treatment, his condition reportedly “improved,” and official said

title: Telangana CM Revanth invites Japanese firms to design and manufacture in Hyderabad
content: Mr. Revanth Reddy says sectors like circular economy, urban infra, AI, software offer huge potential to investors

title: IAF pilot assaulted in Bengaluru road rage incident, hunt on for attacker
content: Wg. Cdr. Shiladitya Bose recorded a video on his mobile from the airport detailing the assault and making an emotional appeal for action against the miscreant.

title: Butler's poise helps Dubs win Game 1 out of '1997'
content: In his first playoff game with the Warriors, Jimmy Butler delivered 25 points, 7 rebounds, 6 assists and 5 steals Sunday night to give the Warriors a 1-0 lead over the Rockets in their first-round playoff series.

title: Jets to pick up 3 options; silent on Rodgers' rant
content: The Jets will pick up the fifth-year options for the 2026 season for all three of their 2022 first-round picks -- cornerback Sauce Gardner, wide receiver Garrett Wilson and pass rusher Jermaine Johnson -- general manager Darren Mougey announced Monday.

title: Hug wins 8th Boston Marathon wheelchair title
content: Marcel Hug of Switzerland blitzed to the front of the field to win his eighth Boston Marathon wheelchair title, claiming the victory Monday in the 129th edition of the race. American Susannah Scaroni won the women's wheelchair race.

title: Italian soccer pauses as Pope Francis dies at 88
content: Monday's Serie A fixtures have been postponed following the death of Pope Francis, the Italian league has announced.

title: Fried's no-hit bid ended by retro scoring change
content: New York Yankees veteran left-hander Max Fried lost a no-hit bid in Sunday's 4-0 victory over the Tampa Bay Rays just as the bottom of the eighth inning was about to start when the official scorer changed a sixth-inning call to a hit from an error.

title: Ex-coach: Biles had 'twisties' before Rio Olympics
content: Simone Biles suffered from the "twisties" ahead of the 2016 Rio Olympics, five years before she withdrew from the team competition at the Tokyo Games with the same mental block.

title: Sources: UGA lands transfer trio, including top LB
content: A trio of transfers -- Army outside linebacker Elo Modozie, Illinois running back Josh McCray and Miami defensive lineman Josh Horton -- have signed with Georgia, sources told ESPN.

title: NBA unveils award finalists for 2024-25 season
content: The NBA unveiled the three finalists for each of its seven major individual awards for the 2024-25 regular season Sunday night.

title: 'Completely separate and at odds': The divisions and chaos that led to the end of the Luka Doncic era in Dallas
content: Doncic's time in Dallas ended with a shocking trade on Feb. 2, but the beginning of the end dates to the summer of 2023.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Previewing Monday's four-game slate
content: Two series begin, while it's Game 2 for Blues-Jets and Stars-Avs. Here are the key storylines in each.

title: 'Football is a chess game': How Abdul Carter rose to the top of NFL draft boards amid position change
content: After earning Penn State's famed No. 11 jersey, how has Abdul Carter positioned himself to be a top-5 pick?

title: How Mikko Rantanen impacts the Stars' Stanley Cup hopes -- in 2025 and well beyond
content: Long a draft-and-develop team, the trade signaled a philosophical shift, with aftershocks still to come.

title: Why Josh Hart -- and his wide-open 3s -- could be the Knicks' playoff key
content: Few guards got more space to shoot this season than Josh Hart. Making playoff defenses pay for it could fuel a Knicks run.

title: NBA Rank, playoffs edition: The 50 most impactful players for 2025
content: From MVP hopefuls to postseason heroes, we're counting down the top 50 players who will decide the 2025 playoffs.

title: Should Trent Alexander-Arnold think twice about leaving Liverpool for Real Madrid?
content: Trent Alexander-Arnold has a big decision to make: sign a new deal at Liverpool this summer or leave for (we think) Real Madrid. Considering recent trends at both teams, he should reconsider joining Los Blancos.

title: A win away from the title, Liverpool coronation begins at Leicester
content: Liverpool's fans were already celebrating the title in the win at Leicester. The team itself will soon join in.

title: Leicester relegated from PL after loss to Liverpool
content: Leicester City have been condemned to an immediate return to the Championship after their relegation from the Premier League was confirmed with a defeat to Liverpool on Sunday.

title: TAA silent on Madrid links after 'special' winner
content: Liverpool defender Trent Alexander-Arnold remained tight-lipped on his future at Anfield amid continued links to Real Madrid, although he added that Sunday's winner over Leicester City would always be "special."

title: Amorim defends Højlund despite scoring woes
content: Ruben Amorim has insisted that Rasmus Højlund is not solely to blame for Manchester United's problems scoring while also urging the rest of the team to take responsibility in front of goal.

title: Valverde 'the key' as Madrid 'react' to UCL exit
content: Carlo Ancelotti praised Federico Valverde as "the key" after the midfielder's 93rd-minute goal gave Real Madrid a dramatic 1-0 win over Athletic Club on Sunday to react to their Champions League exit in midweek.

title: Barcelona rout Chelsea in first leg of UWCL semis
content: Holders Barcelona put themselves in the driving seat with a resounding 4-1 over Chelsea in the first leg of their women's Champions League semifinal on Sunday, with substitute Claudia Pina netting twice.

title: Lewandowski (hamstring) in doubt for UCL semis
content: Barcelona striker Robert Lewandowski is a major doubt for the Copa del Rey final and the Champions League semifinal, sources told ESPN after the team confirmed he has a hamstring injury.

title: St. Pauli draw leaves Leverkusen defence near end
content: Reigning champions Bayer Leverkusen slipped up with a 1-1 draw at St Pauli on Sunday to drop eight points behind leaders Bayern Munich as their slim hopes of defending the Bundesliga title were all but ended.

title: Arteta says Saka 'in pain' but quashes injury fears
content: Arsenal's Mikel Arteta said Bukayo Saka was left in pain after suffering a knock in the 4-0 win at Ipswich, although he ruled out any chance of a "serious" injury.

title: WrestleMania 41 Night 2 results: Cena makes history, beats Rhodes for WWE Undisputed title
content: The next chapter of John Cena's farewell tour kicks off with the WWE Universal championship around his waist. Here are the best moments from WrestleMania 41 Night 2.

title: How Piastri-Verstappen incident led to McLaren's Saudi win
content: After nearly colliding on Lap 1 Max Verstappen was forced to yield to eventual Saudi GP winner Oscar Piastri.

title: Stanley Cup Playoffs Central: Bracket, schedule, scores, news
content: From the first round all the way through the Stanley Cup Final, ESPN has you covered this NHL postseason.

title: What's on the masks of 2025 Stanley Cup playoff goalies? Our guide to all 16 teams
content: The 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs are underway and it's the drip in goal that could potentially steal the show.

title: OU conquers '24 demons, reclaims gymnastics title
content: Fueled by last season's stunning early exit, Oklahoma reclaimed its place atop the college gymnastics world.

title: KC Current, Washington Spirit leapfrog Orlando Pride at the top
content: Orlando's first defeat of 2025 cost the Pride, who fell behind KC and Washington in ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool turn to Atalanta's Lookman
content: Liverpool have turned their attention to Atalanta winger Ademola Lookman. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Decomposed Body Of Minor Found In Septic Tank In Odisha, 1 Arrested
content: Tension prevailed at Ratanpur village in Delanga block of Puri district in Odisha on Monday following the recovery of the decomposed body of a minor boy from the septic tank, who had been missing since April 15.

title: US Vice President JD Vance Meets PM Modi, Talks Focus On Trade Deal
content: JD Vance, who is in India for a four-day visit, met Prime Minister Narendra Modi today for a closed-door meeting. The meeting between the two leaders came at a time when the world is facing uncertainty over a raging US-China trade war.

title: "Hateful Politics": Ex-Poll Body Chief On BJP Leader's "Muslim Commissioner" Jibe
content: Former Chief Election Commissioner SY Quraishi hit back at "Muslim Commissioner" remark of BJP leader Nishikant Dubey today.

title: Hearing, Speech Impaired Man Rapes Minor In Madhya Pradesh, Arrested: Cops
content: An eight-year-old girl was raped by a hearing and speech impaired man in Madhya Pradesh's Katni district, a police official said on Monday.

title: BJP Worker Charged With Sexual Assault In Madhya Pradesh, Expelled From Party
content: A BJP office-bearer from Madhya Pradesh's Sidhi district was booked for allegedly sexually assaulting a woman, following which he was expelled from the ruling party.

title: From Being A Moral Guide To Bishop of Rome: What Exactly Does A Pope Do?
content: With the death of Pope Francis on Monday, the world's cardinals will now head to Rome to elect a successor. So what exactly does a pope do?

title: New Indian Cardinal, Unfulfilled Visit: Pope Francis' Bond With India
content: Pope Francis's connection with India was marked by a mix of hopes and challenges. His long-held wish to visit the country remained unfulfilled. However, just months ago, he elevated an Indian priest, who is a Vatican official, to the rank of Cardinal

title: Indian Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla To Grow Crops, Study Water Bears At Space Station
content: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla is expected to conduct at least seven experiments, including growing crops and studying "ultimate survivors" water bears in space, during his 14-day stay at the International Space Station next month.

title: Video: Swinging Toy Swords, JD Vance's Children Board Plane To Delhi
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his Indian-origin wife Usha Vance and their children, arrived in India today for his first official visit to the country.

title: "Dedicated Himself To The Service Of Others": Dalai Lama Mourns Pope Francis
content: Tibet's spiritual leader the Dalai Lama praised Pope Francis on Monday, offering Buddhist prayers and writing to the papal envoy to "express his sadness" at his death.

title: Delhi Court Summons Trinamool Leader Derek O'Brien In 2024 Protest Case
content: A Delhi court on Monday summoned TMC leaders Derek O'Brien, Sagarika Ghose, Saket Gokhle and other party functionaries for a holding protest in front of the Election Commission of India despite a prohibitory order in April last year.

title: Live Updates: JD Vance Meets PM Modi, Talks Underway
content: Live: US Vice President JD Vance and his wife, the Indian-American Second Lady, Usha Vance, landed in Delhi this morning for his four-day visit to India.

title: All About Possible Candidates Who Might Succeed Pope Francis
content: An old Italian saying warns against putting faith, or money, in any presumed front-runner ahead of the conclave, the closed-door gathering of cardinals that picks the pontiff.

title: Google Settles Android TV Case With Competition Commission
content: Technology major Google on Monday settled with the Competition Commission a nearly four-year-old case related to alleged unfair business practices with respect to Android Smart TV market and has agreed to modify its agreement with vendors.

title: Police Algorithm Said Woman Faces 'Medium' Risk, She Was Killed Weeks Later
content: A Spanish woman was classified as "medium" risk by a police algorithm when she reported threats and past violence by her former partner. Three weeks later, she was killed, allegedly by the same man.

title: Rahul Gandhi Holds 'Dual Citizenship'? Centre Told To Submit Report By May 5
content: The matter related to Gandhi's nationality has the potential of casting a shadow over the Congress MP's from Rae Bareli constituency, as Indian law does not permit dual citizenship.

title: "Tu Hai Kya Cheez": Convict Issues Death Threat To Delhi Judge In Courtroom
content: Convicting a man in a six-year-old check bounce case led to shocking consequences for Delhi judge Shivangi Mangla, who was verbally abused, harassed and threatened in the open courtroom.

title: 'Rest In Peace': Donald Trump After Pope Francis' Death
content: US President Donald Trump paid his respects Monday to Pope Francis, writing "Rest in Peace" in a short post on his Truth Social platform.

title: AI Kiran, A Movement To Empower Women In Artificial Intelligence, Launched
content: AI Kiran - a national movement for inclusive AI leadership - was officially launched today, setting the stage for a multi-year process of recognising, nurturing and growing women leaders in AI.

title: Vatican Postpones Sainthood For "God's Influencer" After Pope's Death
content: Sunday's scheduled canonisation of the Catholic Church's first millennial saint has been postponed to a later date after the death of Pope Francis, the Vatican said on Monday.

content: Karnataka Today Your daily dose of news highlights from the world of cinema and streaming . today's Cache Your download of the top 5 technology stories of the day . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science .

title: European soccer review: Real Madrid still in title race, plus much more
content: the laLiga title race is nearly officially over, but the race for european places is as competitive as ever . in the Bundesliga, Germany's last remaining clubs were knocked out of european competition, but Bayern Munich returned to some sense of normalcy by dismantling a relative minnow .

title: Trump tariffs push Chinese giants to bow to India's terms
content: Amidst escalating trade tensions with the US, fueled by Trump's tariffs, China is seeking new markets, particularly India. Despite past border clashes and investment restrictions, Chinese companies are now showing flexibility, accepting minority stakes and technology transfers to access India's growing market and potentially bypass US tariffs through Indian manufacturing.

title: Watch: KL Rahul returns to 'old home' Ekana stadium as DC face LSG
content: KL Rahul is set to play against Lucknow Super Giants in Lucknow. This IPL 2025 match is important for both Delhi Capitals and LSG. Rahul, now with Delhi, previously captained Lucknow. He has been in good form this season. Both teams are currently tied with 10 points. The match could significantly impact the points table standings.

title: George Soros' son wishes Happy Easter, Elon Musk responds: You ...
content: A brief exchange on X between Alex Soros and Elon Musk has sparked intrigue, given their families' history of public disagreements. It began when Alex Soros shared Easter greetings, to which Musk responded with, “Um … you too”.

title: Trump slams Fed's Powell again as US stocks tumble
content: US stocks plummeted following Donald Trump's criticism of Fed Chair Jerome Powell, with the Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq all experiencing significant declines. Technology stocks like Tesla, Nvidia, and Amazon led the downturn. The US dollar weakened, while gold prices surged. Concerns over inflation and Trump's trade policies added to investor anxiety.

title: What was Pope Francis' take on homosexuality, abortion?
content: Pope Francis, who passed away on Monday, leaves behind a legacy of both upholding and altering Catholic Church teachings. He maintained the church's stance against abortion but advocated for spiritual support for women who had them. While denouncing economic systems that prioritize money, he defended his views as aligned with the Gospel.

title: Rohit Sharma thanks Abhishek Nayar after match-winning knock for MI
content: Following his impressive innings in the IPL, Rohit Sharma expressed gratitude to Abhishek Nayar, his long-time friend and mentor, after Nayar's recent departure as the national team's assistant coach. Despite the termination, Nayar has quickly rejoined the Kolkata Knight Riders, where his return could prove significant, as acknowledged by players like KL Rahul for his invaluable support.

title: Infosys HR’s email to 240 trainees who failed the test: As you …
content: Infosys recently terminated 240 entry-level employees after they failed to clear internal assessment tests, following a similar layoff of over 300 trainees in February. Despite additional preparation and multiple attempts, these System Engineers and Digital Specialist Engineers did not meet the required standards.

title: 'Hindus threatened at gunpoint': BJP's big claims on Murshidabad violence
content: The BJP has alleged that Hindus in Murshidabad were threatened at gunpoint and forced to chant Islamic slogans during recent violence. Union minister Sukanta Majumdar claims these incidents foreshadow a grim future for Hindus across West Bengal. The BJP IT department also shared a video depicting robbery and arson, highlighting the plight of a family allegedly targeted during the unrest.

title: Lion kills 14-year-old girl in Nairobi in presence of another teenager
content: In a tragic incident near Nairobi National Park, a 14-year-old girl was killed by a lion, prompting a search operation by the Kenya Wildlife Service (KWS). Rangers discovered the girl's body near the Mbagathi River, and a trap has been set for the lion. Separately, a 54-year-old man was killed by an elephant in Nyeri County.

title: When LinkedIn co-founder told employees: Go home, have dinner with family then…
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman believes work-life balance is incompatible with startup success, advocating for a relentless work ethic. He argues that those prioritizing balance are not fully committed to winning, emphasizing the intense demands of the startup environment. Hoffman points to the financial rewards reaped by early LinkedIn employees as justification for his demanding approach.

title: 'Bargaining with tiger for its skin': China's stark warning to US
content: China has strongly condemned growing US pressure on its trading partners, pledging to retaliate against actions harming its interests. Washington is reportedly urging allies to reduce trade with Beijing for tariff exemptions, which China views as coercive. Beijing insists on equality in trade talks and warns against protectionism, emphasizing its resolve to defend its rights amidst escalating tariffs.

title: How a video call became first clue in murder of ex-K'taka DGP Om Prakash
content: Former Karnataka police chief Om Prakash was fatally stabbed by his wife, Pallavi, at their HSR Layout residence following a heated argument. Pallavi, who reportedly has schizophrenia, attacked Prakash with chili powder and then inflicted multiple knife wounds. The homicide stemmed from ongoing disputes, including a property disagreement, and authorities are investigating Pallavi's mental state.

title: Golden State's clutch win and OKC's big statement put the West on notice
content: the 2024-25 NBA playoffs are underway, and there are lessons to take from the weekend's results . the no. 1 seed Oklahoma City Thunder clobber the 8-seed Memphis Grizzlies by 51 points for the fifth-largest margin of victory in NBA history .

title: Stanley Cup playoffs first-round guide: Best bets and Conn Smythe predictions
content: the 2025 Stanley Cup playoffs begin on saturday with 16 teams looking to etch their name onto Lord Stanley's Cup . the Winnipeg Jets look to make their first Stanley Cup Final appearance . they will face the los Angeles Kings for the fourth straight postseason .

title: Three killed, six injured in head-on collision near Venkatraopet gate
content: Karnataka Today Your daily dose of news highlights from the world of cinema and streaming . today's Cache Your download of the top 5 technology stories of the day . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science .

title: Pope Francis' India connection: Canonisations, cardinals & visit that wasn’t
content: Pope Francis passing marked the end of a deep relationship with India, characterized by spiritual milestones and recognition of Indian cardinals. Despite his desire, a papal visit never materialized, though he strengthened ties with the Catholic community. Landmark canonizations, including the first Indian layperson declared a saint, brought joy, while liturgical uniformity sparked discord within the Syro-Malabar Church.

title: Road rage shocker: IAF officer, wife attacked by biker in Bengaluru
content: In Bengaluru, an Indian Air Force officer, Wing Commander Aditya Bose, and his wife, Squadron Leader Madhumita, were allegedly assaulted on Sunday evening. According to reports, a biker tailed their car, verbally abused them, and attacked Wing Commander Bose with a key, causing a head injury. The biker further threw a stone, hitting Bose again.

title: Couple caught having sex inside Navi Mumbai Municipal Transport bus
content: A young couple was filmed engaging in sexual activity on a Navi Mumbai Municipal Transport bus, prompting swift action from authorities after the video circulated online. The incident occurred on a bus traveling from Panvel to Kalyan, leading to departmental proceedings against the conductor for failing to intervene. Officials have condemned the act as vulgar and unacceptable in public transport.

title: 'NHL wants Toronto to win': Penalties in Ottawa Senators vs Toronto Maple Leafs
content: Former ice hockey player P. K. Subban criticised a penalty called during the Ottawa Senators versus Toronto Maple Leafs game. He felt the call was soft and changed the game's momentum. Fans online agreed with Subban. Many believe the referees favor Toronto. Some fans think the league wants Toronto to win. Others stated the penalty was a textbook boarding.

title: A conclave & smoke signals: How the next Pope will be chosen
content: Pope Francis, at the age of 88, passed away at 7:35 am, as announced by the Vatican. Cardinal Kevin Farrell confirmed his passing, noting his dedication to the Church and its vulnerable members. The College of Cardinals, consisting of 115 eligible members, will convene in Rome for a secret conclave to elect his successor, following centuries-old traditions.

title: Son of murdered ex-K'taka DGP reveals chilling threats by mother, sister
content: Former Karnataka DGP Om Prakash was allegedly murdered by his wife Pallavi and daughter Kriti at their HSR Layout home. His son Kartikesh filed a complaint, citing prior threats. Om Prakash was found with fatal injuries. Both accused have been arrested, and further investigation is ongoing to uncover the motive.

title: IPL 2025: RR captain Sanju Samson to miss next match against RCB too
content: Rajasthan Royals captain Sanju Samson will miss the upcoming match against Royal Challengers Bengaluru. He is recovering from a side strain injury sustained during a previous game. Samson is currently at the team's home base undergoing rehab. The team management is closely monitoring his progress. His return to action will be decided on a game-by-game basis.

title: Pope Francis dies: World leaders mourn passing away of 'beacon of hope'
content: Pope Francis, the first Jesuit and non-European pontiff in over 1,200 years, passed away on Easter Monday at the age of 88. His papacy, which began in 2013, was defined by his focus on mercy, inclusiveness, and environmental concerns. World leaders are mourning the loss of a figure who championed justice and compassion, while the Vatican prepares for the election of a new pope.

title: Who is Zikra? 'Lady Don' behind Seelampur teen’s murder was grooming gangs of minors
content: Zikra, a self-proclaimed 'Lady Don' with ties to a gangster's family, is implicated in the murder of a 17-year-old. Arrested previously for Arms Act violations and social media displays of firearms, she allegedly groomed a gang of minors for criminal activities. Nine individuals, including two minors and the main accused, Sahil, have been apprehended.

title: Women forced to walk miles in 44°C heat to fetch drinking water in Yavatmal
content: Across Vidarbha, Yavatmal's Phanse Pardhi settlements face a severe water crisis as temperatures soar. Women risk their lives daily, walking kilometers to fetch water from uncovered wells due to the failure of government schemes and lack of infrastructure. Classified as encroachments, these communities are excluded from basic amenities, highlighting the urgent need for government intervention to alleviate their suffering.

title: SC confirms probe against Ranveer Allahbadia is complete
content: The Supreme Court has confirmed the completion of the investigation into YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia, also known as BeerBiceps, regarding FIRs filed over controversial remarks on 'India's Got Latent.' A hearing is scheduled for April 28 to consider Allahbadia’s plea for his passport's return, with a chargesheet expected soon from Maharashtra police. The court had previously granted permission for him to resume his podcast under certain content restrictions.

title: Meghan accused of copying author’s work for show
content: Meghan Markle faces plagiarism accusations as British author Mel Elliott claims striking similarities between Markle's shelved animated series 'Pearl' and her 'Pearl Power' children's books. Elliott sent legal notices to Archewell, alleging copyright infringement, but received no response. This isn't the first time Markle's projects have been compared to existing works, raising concerns about originality.

title: 'Hates Hindus': BJP flays CM Mamata for not visiting Murshidabad
content: The BJP has strongly criticised West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee for her absence from violence-affected Murshidabad, alleging anti-Hindu bias. BJP MP Sambit Patra claimed Banerjee would have reacted differently if Muslims were victims. The party also accused CPI (M) of disowning deceased Hindu workers, highlighting the politicization of the Murshidabad clashes following protests against the Waqf (Amendment) Act.

title: 'Never seen CSK struggle this much': Raina questions auction strategy
content: Chennai Super Kings' IPL 2025 campaign faces dire straits after a crushing defeat to Mumbai Indians, marking their sixth loss. Suresh Raina criticised the team's auction strategy, lamenting the missed opportunities to acquire key players like Rishabh Pant and KL Rahul. Harbhajan Singh echoed these concerns, questioning the impact of the youth selections.

title: With Pope Francis gone, who are 4 Indian Cardinals to vote for his successor?
content: Following Pope Francis's death at 88, the Vatican is observing the Novendiale, a nine-day mourning period. Preparations are underway for the Papal Conclave, where 135 cardinals will elect the new Pope. Among them, four hail from India: Cardinals Filipe Neri Ferrao, Baselios Cleemis, Anthony Poola, and George Jacob Koovakad.

title: Who is Camerlengo? the man now at helm of Vatican after Pope Francis' death
content: Following Pope Francis's death on Easter Monday, Cardinal Kevin Farrell, the Vatican's camerlengo, announced the news and assumed leadership during the 'sede vacante.' Farrell will oversee the Church's daily operations, prepare for the funeral, and facilitate the election of a new pope. As camerlengo, he now plays a vital administrative role during this period of transition for the Catholic Church.

title: 'Kohli shows why he's a legend': Sehwag in awe of chase master
content: Virat Kohli's unbeaten 73 guided Royal Challengers Bengaluru to a crucial victory over Punjab Kings. Kohli anchored the innings with Devdutt Padikkal, who scored 61, forming a match-defining partnership. Virender Sehwag praised Kohli's ability to finish games under pressure, highlighting his match-winning temperament and consistency in chases, making him a true legend.

title: Taylor Swift gets called out for using private jet amid Katy Perry’s space trip
content: Taylor Swift faces criticism for her carbon footprint after a fan account seemingly defended her private jet use by referencing Katy Perry's involvement in Blue Origin's space trip. Fans argue that both activities contribute to environmental damage, regardless of scale. This surfaces amidst Kanye West controversy, where Swift has taken legal action following his explicit social media posts about her.

title: 'Death of the salaried': CEO Mukherjea's big warning on white collar jobs
content: Investment strategist Saurabh Mukherjea warns of a decline in white-collar employment in India due to automation and AI. He suggests that traditional salaried jobs are becoming unsustainable, particularly in sectors like IT and finance. Mukherjea advocates for entrepreneurship, supported by India's digital infrastructure, as a viable alternative for the educated workforce.

title: How Russia recruits troops in occupied Ukrainian territories
content: Russia's recent conscription surge, the largest in 14 years, aims to bolster its military amid the Ukraine conflict, with reports indicating forced recruitment in occupied territories like Donetsk and Luhansk. Men are coerced into service through passport requirements and economic pressure, facing deployment to the front lines after brief training.

title: IPL 2025: Crorepatis who are yet to get off the mark
content: Several high-priced players in IPL 2025 are yet to debut despite hefty price tags. Mayank Yadav (LSG), T Natarajan (DC), Jacob Bethell (RCB), Gerald Coetzee (GT), and Rahmanullah Gurbaz (KKR) were signed for substantial amounts but haven't featured due to team dynamics, fitness, or strong performances from existing players. Their potential inclusion could impact team strategies as the tournament progresses.

title: 'Hateful politics': Ex-CEC hits back at BJP's Dubey
content: Former Chief Election Commissioner S Y Quraishi has strongly condemned BJP MP Nishikant Dubey's communal remarks, denouncing it as an attempt to exploit religion for divisive politics. Quraishi defended his tenure and commitment to secularism, emphasizing that individuals should be valued for their contributions, not their religious identity.

title: 'We’re accused of encroaching on Parliament, executive functions': SC
content: The Supreme Court addressed concerns about potentially overstepping its constitutional boundaries while hearing a petition concerning recent violence in West Bengal related to protests against the Waqf Amendment Act. Justice Gavai's bench acknowledged allegations of encroaching on parliamentary and executive functions. Advocate Vishnu Shankar Jain requested directions to the Centre under Article 355, suggesting President's Rule due to the unrest.

title: Neeraj Chopra's next big throw: A global event with his name on it
content: Neeraj Chopra, the celebrated Indian javelin star, is set to launch the inaugural Neeraj Chopra Classic (NC Classic) on May 24 in Bengaluru. This World Athletics Category A event marks his contribution to Indian athletics, featuring international stars like Anderson Peters and Thomas Rohler. Chopra also extended an invitation to Pakistani Olympic champion Arshad Nadeem, but is yet to be confirmed.

title: Pope Francis passes away: What was the cause of his death?
content: Pope Francis, the first Latin American pontiff, passed away at the age of 88 on April 21 after a prolonged battle with respiratory illnesses and kidney failure. The head of the Catholic Church, who had served since 2013, was hospitalized multiple times for a respiratory tract infection that developed into double pneumonia.

title: Serie A postpones matches as Italian football mourns Pope Francis’ death
content: Following the death of Pope Francis at 88, Serie A has postponed four matches scheduled for Monday, including Torino vs. Udinese and Lazio vs. Genoa. The Italian football federation (FIGC) has also delayed all professional and amateur games. The Pope, remembered as a football enthusiast, was described by the FIGC as an example of Christian charity.

title: 'Will be remembered as beacon of compassion': PM Modi condoles Pope Francis
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday mourned on the death of Pope Francis, describing the pontiff as a global symbol of "beacon of compassion, humility and spiritual courage". "I fondly recall my meetings with him and was greatly inspired by his commitment to inclusive and all-round development. His affection for the people of India will always be cherished. May his soul find eternal peace in God’s embrace," he said.

title: How oceans can help in reducing carbon dioxide
content: In UK, Project SeaCURE is pioneering technology to extract CO₂ directly from seawater, enhancing the ocean's natural carbon absorption. This initiative aims to combat climate change by capturing CO₂ before it escapes, using sustainable materials.

content: the TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide . from running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents . the desk is adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary .
